channel.title: Tech Talks
channel.description: Its a collection of technical talks that I enjoyed watching. I have avoided putting product announcements or company specific talks.You can also contribute to the list by forking on github.

item.title: The Value of Values with Rich Hickey
item.description: Great talk on how immutability is the basis of modern information systems.

item.title: User interface algorithms @JSConf by Mark DiMarco
item.description: Great talk on how math meets user interface design.

item.title: Legacy - Creating software that lasts long : Scala Days 2014
item.description: Great talk on how to build computer systems like biological systems which will evolve with time.

item.title: Design sprints - Google I/O 2014
item.description: Great talk on how to design and prototype within a week. Concrete examples from Google Ventures and Google X.

item.title: Programming is terrible-Lessons learned from a life wasted
item.description: Great rant on the state of programming art in industry.

item.title: Growing a Language - Guy Steele
item.description: Guy Steele’s keynote at the 1998 ACM OOPSLA conference on “Growing a Language” discusses the importance of and issues associated with designing a programming language that can be grown by its users.

item.title: Scala: The Simple Parts - Martin Odersky
item.description: Good talk by Martin Odersky on what constitutes as core part of scala.

item.title: The Mother of All Demos - Douglas Engelbart
item.description: Great demo of computer mouse, video conferencing, teleconferencing, hypertext, word processing, hypermedia, object addressing and dynamic file linking, bootstrapping, and a collaborative real-time editor in 1968!!.

item.title: Stop Drawing Dead Fish
item.description: Another demo of interactive programming by Bret-victor.

item.title: JavaScript Programming Style and Your Brain - Douglas Crockford
item.description: Understanding why functional programming is natural to our brain.
